page.title: 13THE COMMON, HENFIELD.
page.content: The Common is a large expanse of land which grows fairly wild and free.There is a cricket pitch and bowling green. Sometimes there are Circuses or Fun-fairs on the Common. It is funny to see llamas and camels roaming about! The Summer Show used to be held here under a big marquee. There was a big Firework Display held here during the Silver Jubilee Celebrations and an Elizabethan Fair. There is an old horse trough. There are bridle paths and footpaths about. There is plenty of wild-life. When I went I saw different insects and grasses. There were spiders and stag-beetles. I picked up a log and underneath was an ants' nest but it wasn't very big. There were moths and butterflies and grasshoppers. There was plenty of cuckoo spit. I saw blackbirds and blue-tits.
